title: Opening Scripts and Hooks
description: Craft compelling openings that capture attention and earn the right to continue.

lessons.title: The First 10 Seconds
lessons.content: You have about 10 seconds to earn attention. Learn how to make every word count.
objectives: Understand what makes an opening effective
Learn the anatomy of a great hook
keyPoints: Lead with value, not your name and company
Pattern interrupt to stand out from other callers
Match your energy to your prospect's world

exercises.title: Hook Workshop
exercises.instructions: Write 5 different opening hooks for the same target persona. Test them in role-play.

lessons.title: Permission-Based Openings
lessons.content: Asking for permission shows respect and increases engagement. Learn when and how to use this technique.
objectives: Know when to ask and when to lead
keyPoints: "Is now a bad time?" often gets better results than "Do you have a minute?"
Some situations call for direct approaches

exercises.title: Permission Practice
exercises.instructions: Practice 3 calls using permission-based openings with the AI prospect.

lessons.title: Value Proposition Statements
lessons.content: Your value prop must be clear, specific, and relevant. Learn to articulate value in seconds.
keyPoints: Make it about them, not you

exercises.title: Value Prop Builder
exercises.instructions: Create value propositions for 3 different decision-maker personas.

scenarios.title: Breaking Through to a Busy Executive
scenarios.description: Practice your opening on a time-pressed VP who gets 20 cold calls a day.
scenarios.personaHint: Use the busy-exec persona. Be concise and lead with value.

scenarios.title: The Skeptical Gatekeeper
scenarios.description: Get past a protective assistant to reach the decision-maker.
scenarios.personaHint: Focus on being professional and providing value to the gatekeeper.
